newsitem.title: USA: Emery names Scott as air operations head.
newsitem.headline: Emery names Scott as air operations head.

text.p: Emery Worldwide Express has named Kent Scott vice president and chief operating officer of air operations, the company said.
Emery said in a statement that Scott, who succeeds the retiring Willard Scherrer, will be responsible for operations of the company's fleet of almost 100 owned and leased jet aircraft.

The carrier's 500 pilots, mechanics and staff administrators will report to Scott. His duties also include responsibility for long-range strategic planning of the company's airhaul network, fleet operations and subcontractor management.

Emery said Scott, a former B-747 captain with Trans World Airlines, joins Emery from AirSpace International Airlines of Carson, California, where he was chief executive officer for the start-up and development of that B-747 all-cargo airline.
Prior to joining AirSpace International, Scott was vice president operations for Polar Air Cargo, when the carrier began operations in 1994. -Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017
